008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.mser.components;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.HashSet;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016import java.util.LinkedList;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.mser.MserData;
021import imagingbook.common.mser.components.PixelMap.Pixel;
022
023/**
024 * Abstract class representing a tree of extremal image components.
025 * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
026 */
027public abstract class ComponentTree<T> implements Iterable<Component<T>> {
028        
029        /**
030         * Enumeration specifying the method (algorithm) for building the component tree.
031         */
032        public enum Method {
033                /** Specifies the classic (global immersion) algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion}. */
034                GlobalImmersion,
035                /** Specifies the linear-time algorithm, see {@link ComponentTreeLinearTime}. */
036                LinearTime;
037        }
038        
039        // --------------------------------------------------------------
040        
041        ComponentTree() {               // non-public constructor
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image using the
046         * default method ({@link Method#LinearTime}).
047         * @param <T> the generic node type
048         * @param ip the input image
049         * @return the component tree for the specified image
050         */
051        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip) {
052                return from(ip, Method.LinearTime);
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Creates a new component tree for the specified image.
057         * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
058         * @param ip the input (gray-level) image
059         * @param method the method for building the component tree
060         * @return the component tree
061         */
062        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(ByteProcessor ip, Method method) {
063                return from(new PixelMap(ip), method);
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Creates a new component tree for the specified {@link PixelMap}.
068         * @param <T> the data type of components (e.g., {@link MserData})
069         * @param pm a {@link PixelMap} instance
070         * @param method the method for building the component tree
071         * @return the component tree
072         */
073        public static <T> ComponentTree<T> from(PixelMap pm, Method method) {
074                switch (method) {
075                case LinearTime:  return new ComponentTreeLinearTime<>(pm);
076                case GlobalImmersion: return new ComponentTreeGlobalImmersion<>(pm);
077                }
078                return null;
079        }
080        
081        // --------------------------------------------------------------
082
083        /**
084         * Returns the root component of this component tree.
085         * @return the root component
086         */
087        public abstract Component<T> getRoot();
088
089        /**
090         * Returns an unordered collection of all tree components.
091         * @return all tree components
092         */
093        public abstract Collection<Component<T>> getComponents();
094        
095        @Override
096        public Iterator<Component<T>> iterator() {
097                return getComponents().iterator();
098        }
099        
100        /**
101         * Finds and returns a collection of all leaf components of this tree.
102         * A leaf is a component which has no children.
103         * @return all leaf components
104         */
105        public Collection<Component<T>> getLeaves() {
106                Collection<Component<T>> leaves = new LinkedList<>();
107                for (Component<T> c : getComponents()) {
108                        if (c.getChildren().isEmpty()) {
109                                leaves.add(c);
110                        }
111                }       
112                return leaves;
113        }
114        
115        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
116        
117        /**
118         * Performs integrity checks on this component tree.
119         * @return true iff all checks are passed
120         */
121        public boolean validate() {
122                if (!checkNodes()) {
123                        System.out.println("checkNodes failed");
124                        return false;
125                }
126                if (!checkParents()) {
127                        System.out.println("checkParents failed");
128                        return false;
129                }
130                if (!checkChildren()) {
131                        System.out.println("checkChildren failed");
132                        return false;
133                }
134                if (!checkRoot()) {
135                        System.out.println("checkRoot failed");
136                        return false;
137                }
138                if (!checkLevels()) {
139                        System.out.println("checkLevels failed");
140                        return false;
141                }
142                if (!checkSize()) {
143                        System.out.println("checkSize failed");
144                        return false;
145                }
146                return true;
147        }
148        
149        
150        /**
151         * Checks if all tree nodes reachable through root are contained in components list
152         * and the tree has no duplicate nodes (and no cycles).
153         * @return true iff OK
154         */
155        boolean checkNodes() {
156                Set<Component<T>> componentSet = new HashSet<>(); // empty hash set
157                int duplicateID = traverse(getRoot(), componentSet);
158                if (duplicateID >= 0) {         // traverse() registers all visited components
159                        System.out.println("*** component tree has duplicate node: " + duplicateID);
160                        return false;
161                }
162                if (getComponents().size() != componentSet.size()) {
163                        System.out.println("*** some nodes in components list can not be reached!");
164                        return false;
165                }
166                return true;
167        }
168        
169        int traverse(Component<T> c, Set<Component<T>> cS) {
170                if (cS.add(c)) {
171                        for (Component<T> cc : c.getChildren()) {
172                                int duplicateId = traverse(cc, cS);
173                                if (duplicateId >= 0) { // duplicate node
174                                        return duplicateId;
175                                };
176                        }
177                        return -1;      // everything OK, no duplicate node
178                }
179                else {  // c was already in set
180                        System.out.println("*** duplicate tree node: " + c.ID);
181                        return c.ID;
182                }
183        }
184
185        /**
186         * Checks if all parent relations are consistent.
187         * @return true iff OK
188         */
189        boolean checkParents() {
190                Collection<Component<T>> comps = getComponents();
191                HashSet<Component<T>> compsH = new HashSet<>(comps); // to improve lookup speed
192                
193                for (Component<?> c : comps) {
194                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
195                        if (p == null) {
196                                continue;
197                        }
198                        
199                        // check if parent is listed in 'components' (use HashSet for speed)
200                        if (!compsH.contains(p)) {
201                                System.out.println("*** component not contained in components list: " + c.ID);
202                                return false;
203                        }
204                                                
205                        // check if parent is not c itself
206                        if (p == c) {
207                                System.out.println("*** self-referring parent link in component " + c.ID);
208                                return false;
209                        }                               
210                }
211                return true;
212        }
213        
214        /**
215         * Checks if all child relations are consistent.
216         * @return true iff OK
217         */
218        boolean checkChildren() {
219                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
220                        // check if children is a list (not null)
221                        if (c.getChildren() == null) {
222                                System.out.println("*** children is null (not an empty list) in component " + c.ID);
223                                return false;
224                        }
225                        
226                        // check if all children of c have c as parent
227                        for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
228                                // check if c is parent of its child:
229                                if (child.getParent() != c) {
230                                        System.out.println("*** incorrect parent link in component " + child.ID);
231                                        return false;
232                                }
233                        }       
234                }
235                return true;
236        }
237        /** 
238         * Checks if the tree has a unique root.
239         * @return true iff OK
240         */
241        boolean checkRoot() {
242                // check if a single root exists and is properly marked (with null parent)
243                int rootcnt = 0;
244                Component<T> root = getRoot();
245                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
246                        if (c.getParent() == null) {
247                                rootcnt++;
248                                if (c != root) {
249                                        System.out.println("*** found non-root node without parent: " + c.ID);
250                                        return false;
251                                }
252                        }
253                }
254                if (rootcnt > 1) {
255                        System.out.println("*** found multiple roots: " + rootcnt);
256                        return false;
257                }
258                return true;
259        }
260        
261        /**
262         * Checks if all local pixels of have the same value as {@link #level}.
263         * @return true iff OK
264         */
265        boolean checkLevels() {
266                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
267                        int lc = c.getLevel();
268                        
269                        // check if parent's level is greater than this component's level:
270                        Component<?> p = c.getParent();
271                        if (p != null) {
272                                int lp = p.getLevel();
273                                if (lc >= lp) { // must be lc < lp
274                                        System.out.println("*** value lc >= lp for component " + c.ID);
275                                }
276                        }
277                        
278                        // check if all local points have the same level as this component's level:
279                        for (Pixel x : c.getLocalPixels()) {
280                                if (x.val != lc) {
281                                        System.out.println("*** local pixel with wrong value in component " + c.ID);
282                                        return false;
283                                }
284                        }
285                }
286                return true;
287        }
288        
289        /**
290         * Checks if the size of each component is the same as the number of
291         * local pixels plus the combined size of all children.
292         * @return true iff OK
293         */
294        boolean checkSize() {
295                for (Component<?> c : getComponents()) {
296                        int csize = c.getLocalPixels().size();
297                        for (Component<?> cc : c.getChildren()) {
298                                csize = csize + cc.getSize();
299                        }
300                        if (csize != c.getSize()) {
301                                System.out.println("*** wrong size in component " + c.ID);
302                                return false;
303                        }
304                }
305                return true;
306        }
307        
308        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
309        
310        @Override
311        public String toString() { 
312                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
313                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
314                this.printToStream(ps);
315                return os.toString();
316        }
317        
318        private void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
319                strm.print(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": ");
320                strm.format("   number of components: %d\n", getComponents().size());
321                for (Component<?> r : getComponents()) {
322                        r.printToStream(strm);
323                        strm.println();
324                }
325                strm.println("root = " + getRoot());
326        }
327        
328        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
329        
330        private static int INDENT = 4;
331        
332        // print a forest with multiple roots
333        static String toStringRecursive(ComponentTree<?> rt) { 
334                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
335                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
336                
337                for (Component<?> c : rt) {
338                        if (c.getParent() == null || c.getParent() == c) {      // start at any root
339                                printToStreamRecursive(c, ps, 0);
340                        }       
341                }       
342                return os.toString();
343        }
344        
345        // print tree with a single root
346        static String toStringRecursive(Component<?> rt) { 
347                ByteArrayOutputStream os = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
348                PrintStream ps = new PrintStream(os);
349                printToStreamRecursive(rt, ps, 0);      
350                return os.toString();
351        }
352        
353        
354        private static void printToStreamRecursive(Component<?> c, PrintStream ps, int indent) {
355                for (int i=0; i < indent; i++) {
356                        ps.append('|');
357                        for (int j = 0; j < INDENT; j++) {
358                                ps.append(' ');
359                        }
360                }
361                c.printToStream(ps);
362                ps.println();
363                for (Component<?> child : c.getChildren()) {
364                        printToStreamRecursive(child, ps, indent + 1);
365                }
366        }
367
368}
